Fuck textbook publishers.



I was starting my semester having paid just over $200 for textbooks. Now, that might seem like a lot of money, but it was under half of what I paid for textbooks last semester. So, after customarily dropping my worst class, I added History of Jazz and went to buy my textbooks. They cost me an extra $140. That's after I subtracted the amount I was credited for returning my textbook from my dropped class. This particular textbook - not even a hardcover - cost $100.50. Are you kidding me? How can they possibly justify prices like this? Then I noticed the 2-CD jazz sampler that came with the book. I could only conclude that the high price included an implied license to distribute the music on my favorite torrent sites. So if you need a haphazardly compiled, generally directionless sampling of jazz and pre-jazz tunes, I've posted it here for you.

Oh, and fuck textbook publishers.

CD 1
1. People of Dagomba, Ghana - Kasuan Kura
2. Georgia Sea Island Singers - Daniel (Shout) (excerpt)
3. Marian Anderson - Dere's No Hidin' Place
4. Annie Grace Horn Dodson - Field Hands' Call
5. Scott Joplin - Maple Leaf Rag (excerpt)
6. Ferdinand "Jelly Roll" Morton - Maple Leaf Rag (excerpt)
7. Bessie Smith - Backwater Blues
8. Original Dixieland Jazz Band - Tiger Rag
9. King Oliver's Creole Jazz Band - Dippermouth Blues
10. Jelly Roll Morton's Hot Peppers - Grandpa's Spells
11. Louis Armstrong and His Hot Five - West End Blues
12. Frankie Trumbauer and His Orchestra - Singin' the Blues
13. Art Tatum - Tiger Rag
14. Duke Ellington and His Orchestra - East St. Louis Toodle-Oo
15. Django Reinhardt and the Quinette du Hot Club de France - Tiger Rag (with Stephanie Grappelli)
16. Fletcher Henderson and His Orchestra - Down South Camp Meeting
17. Andy Kirk and His Twelve Clouds of Joy - Mary's Idea
18. Jones-Smith Incorporated - Shoe Shine Boy
19. Benny Goodman and His Orchestra - Solo Flight
20. Duke Ellington and His Famous Orchestra - Sepia Panorama
21. International Sweethearts of Rhythm - Vi Vigor
22. Colman Hawkins and His Orchestra - Body and Soul
23. Billie Holiday and Her Orchestra - Body and Soul
24. Dizzy Gillespie and His All Stars - Salt Peanuts
25. Dizzy Gillespie and His Orchestra - Manteca (with Chano Pozo)
26. Thelonious Monk Quintet - Four In One
27. Miles Davis and His Orchestra - Jeru
28. Ella Fitzgerald and Louis Armstrong - They Can't Take That Away From Me

CD2
1. Art Blakey and the Jazz Messengers - Moanin' (excerpt)
2. Clifford Brown - Max Roach Quintet - Powell's Prances
3. Charles Mingus and His Orchestra - Hora Decubitus
4. Miles Davis Sextet - So What (excerpt)
5. Ornette Coleman - Street Woman
6. John Coltrane - Acknowledgement
7. Albert Ayler Trio - Ghosts: First Variation
8. Bill Evans Trio - Autumn Leaves (excerpts)
9. Miles Davis - It's About That Time / In A Silent Way (excerpt)
10. The Herbie Hancock Group - Chameleon (excerpt)
11. Chick Corea and Return to Forever - Hymn of the Seventh Galaxy
12. Wynton Marsalis Ensemble - Express Crossing
13. George Benson - Softly, As in a Morning Sunrise
14. Elaine Elias - One Note Samba
15. Steve Coleman and Five Elements - Salt Peanuts
16. Tim Hagans - Far West

Some of the bitrates are a little low (one track averages below 90 kbps) but I assure you, they're all encoded with LAME V0 in EAC. I've included a LOG for the skeptical.
2008 - Second Edition
